oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Electrostatics determine vibrational frequency shifts in hydrogen bonded complexes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: DEY, A
MONDAL, SI
SEN, S
GHOSH, D
PATWARI, GN
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: OH STRETCHING VIBRATIONS
PERTURBATION-THEORY
DOUBLE-RESONANCE
RED-SHIFT
NO-SHIFT
SPECTROSCOPY
CHLOROFORM
MOLECULES
ENERGY
LENGTH
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The red-shifts in the acetylenic C-H stretching vibration of C-H center dot center dot center dot X (X = O, N) hydrogen-bonded complexes increase with an increase in the basicity of the Lewis base. Analysis of various components of stabilization energy suggests that the observed red-shifts are correlated with the electrostatic component of the stabilization energy, while the dispersion modulates the stabilization energy.
